Header.Name: Letter
Header.Description: Generic elements for letters, using a combination of elements from EMLO template and the Correspondence Metadata Interchange Format (CMIF) and the generic components (using PiCo).

Component.name: Letter
Component.Documentation: A single message from a sender to one or more organizations or people.

Component.name: Identifier
Component.Documentation: A unique identifier of the resource being described or cataloged. Usage note: The identifier is a text string which is assigned to the resource to provide an unambiguous reference within a particular context. The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc.

Element.name: identifierLabel
Element.Documentation: Add the preferred label for this identifier.

Element.name: identifierUrl
Element.Documentation: The complete URL if the identifier has a web locator. If it is OpenStreetMaps: Enter the URI from OpenStreetMap API. You can search directly in OpenStreetMaps and paste the URI here. The URI has to have this format, for example: https://www.openstreetmap.org/relation/214885 (note the type in the middle: relation, node, way)

Element.name: schemeAgency
Element.Documentation: The name of the external source/knowledge base used to get the identifier.

Element.name: nameOrTitle
Element.Documentation: The name of a Source. For Sources: Use a user-friendly name to identify the source. Depending on the Source type, this may contain a combination of it's name, year of creation, creator, et cetera.

Element.name: additionalType
Element.Documentation: Recommendation for vocabularies to use: https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Property:resource_type. You can use a term from the PiCo thesaurus for Source types: https://terms.personsincontext.org/sourcetypes . (Internal note: this property is equivalent as this one in PiCo: https://schema.org/additionalType).

Element.name: accessURL
Element.Documentation: A URL of the resource that gives access to it. In PiCo: A media object, usually a scan, that encodes the Source of a Person observation (https://schema.org/associatedMedia).

Element.name: landingPage
Element.Documentation: Optional: A Web page that can be navigated to in a Web browser to gain access to the catalog, a dataset, [a source], its distributions and/or additional information (e.g., HTML page with description, metadata, links, DOI landing page, catalog page, Zotero item page)

Element.name: abstract
Element.Documentation: An abstract is a short description that summarizes a CreativeWork.

Element.name: zoteroGroupItemLink
Element.Documentation: Add here the link to the item in the Zotero group: 1) go to https://www.zotero.org/groups/6097405/ecodicesnl. 2) Right-click on the item and select the option "copy link". 3) Paste the link here. Here's an example item URL: https://www.zotero.org/groups/4804340/hereyourgroupname/items/EQ2D34GW

Element.name: correspondenceAction
Element.Documentation: This class comprises the activities making up processes of correspondence items involving at least two persons. This class and its subclasses have been adapted from the TEI standard for correspondences, specifically drawing from the correspAction element.

Element.name: personAsText
Element.Documentation: Write here the person observation as it is in the source (as written, transcribed, or extracted).

Element.name: confidenceValue
Element.Documentation: How confident you (or an algorithm) are of an observation (what you observed (read) in the source), or of a reconstruction. Reflect the uncertainties and ambiguities of the inferred observation (or reconstruction) by choosing one of the values.

Element.name: category
Element.Documentation: Type of relationship.

Element.name: description
Element.Documentation: Description or notes clarifying the relationship.

Element.name: date
Element.Documentation: Date in which this relationship took place (if applicable).

Component.name: ReconstructionActivity
Component.Documentation: The Activity that generated a PersonReconstruction. A Person Reconstruction can either be created by a human researcher or by a software algorithm. In case of a human-made reconstruction, provide information about the time, place and knowledge- input. In case of a software algorithm, provide information about the name, version and configuration settings of the program.

Element.name: typeActivity
Element.Documentation: Register which type of activity was used to make the reconstruction (not from PiCo, t.b.d.)

Element.name: agent
Element.Documentation: The agent (person or organisation) that is responsible for the creation of a person reconstruction.

Element.name: startedAtTime
Element.Documentation: The start time of the activity that generated a Person Reconstruction.

Element.name: endedAtTime
Element.Documentation: The end time of the activity that generated a Person Reconstruction.

Element.name: confidenceValue
Element.Documentation: How confident you (or an algorithm) are of an observation (what you observed (read) in the source), or of a reconstruction. Reflect the uncertainties and ambiguities of the inferred observation (or reconstruction) by choosing one of the values.

Element.name: dateStart
Element.Documentation: Use this field to enter a specific date (if there is no date range), or the beginning of a date range . Select from the calendar. Adapt if necessary following this pattern: YYYY-MM-DD. If there are uncertainties, use these two uncertainty patterns (here with an example): PATTERN1: 2025-??-17 (use "?" to replace uncertain values, here the day is known to be the 17th, the year is 2025 but the month is unknown). PATTERN2: ~2025-~07 (use "~" to indicate approximate values, here it means that both the year and the month are approximate values). COMBINED example: ~2025-??-17.

Element.name: dateEnd
Element.Documentation: Use this field to enter the end date if there was a range. Follow the same instructions as for dateStart.

Element.Documentation: :Add any clarifying notes related to the dates. These notes may be for internal or external use (t.b.d.)
